statement.tex: %text Commander Spock of Star Treck would like to invest for some money for $2$ Vulcan years. He has two choices - The{\bf Solar-Earth} Bank (on planet Earth) or the{\bf Vulcan National} Bank (on planet Vulcan). Solar-Earth offers $3\%$ compounded semi- annually while Vulcan National offers $6\%$ per annum. Which bank should Commander Spock choose given that $2$ Earth years equal $1$ Vulcan year. %

step.context: %text If $2$ Earth years equals $1$ Vulcan year, and the Earth bank compounds semi-annually, how many times would it compound interest in $1$ Vulcan year? %
step.reason: %text The number of times Earth Bank compounds money in $1$ Vulcan year can be established by the following calculation, % \begin{align} &{\small 1\text{(vulcan-yr)}\times 2\left(\dfrac{\text{earth-yr}}{\text{vulcan-yr}}\right)\times 2\left(\dfrac{\text{times-comp}}{\text{earth-yr}}\right)} \\ &={\small 4\text{(times-comp)}} \end{align} \\ %text Therefore, Earth Bank effectively compounds money $4$ times per Vulcan year. %

step.context: %text If Solar-Earth compounds money $4$ times per Vulcan year at $3\%$ and Vulcan-National does so $2$ times per Vulcan year at $6\%$, then what would the balance in each bank be at the end of $1$ Vulcan year on a principle of $P$ dollars? %
step.reason: %text The expression for the amount resulting from compound interest is, % \text{Amount}= \text{Principle}\left[1+\dfrac{\text{rate}}{100}\right]^\text{cycles} \\ %text cycles = \text{times compounded}\times\text{no. of years} \\

step.context: \begin{align} A_\text{Solar-Earth}&= P \left[1+\dfrac{3}{100}\right]^{4\times 1} \\ A_\text{Vulcan-National}&= P \left[1+\dfrac{6}{100}\right]^{2\times 1} \end{align} \\ %text Which is greater, $A_{Solar-Earth}$ or $A_{Vulcan-National}$? %
step.reason: \begin{align} A_\text{Solar-Earth}&= P \left[1+\dfrac{3}{100}\right]^{4\times 1} \\ &= P(1.03)^4 = {\bf P(1.1255)} \\ A_\text{Vulcan-National}&= P \left[1+\dfrac{6}{100}\right]^{2\times 1} \\ &= P(1.06)^2=P(1.1236) \end{align} \\ %text Commander Spock best invest on Earth! %
